Lets play a text adventure game, rules below:

1. The game is set entirely in the universe of Kentaro Miura’s Berserk.
2. Always use the proper names of characters, monsters, demons, weapons, items, skills, equipment, locations, spells, enchantments from the original manga Berserk.
3. As the player, I take the role of the character Puck, Guts’ trusted fairy companion.
4. The game will play in turns; Start each turn by creating a detailed description of an encounter with a new foe (a monster, demon, character, enemy, or your own creation that resembles any of these) with whom Guts must defeat to survive.
5. Each foe must be more formidable than the foe from the previous turn.
6. The task of the player is to provide Guts with advice on how to slay the foe, creatively using ANY of the possible means available to him (such as his unique weapons, surroundings, his foe’s weapons or body-parts, abilities, skills, brute force, prizes). The reward for the player upon Guts’ victory in battle is a prize (the prize must always be something that would be of interest to Puck, it should also be something that could potentially aide Guts in his encounters).
7. After describing the encounter always present the player with 3 lettered options representing what to say to Guts (in the style of the character Puck as written in the manga).
8. Always wait for me, the player, to choose an option.
9. Once I choose an option assume that Guts heeds my advice and create a detailed description of how the battle finishes and a short description of any reward given to the player. After these descriptions, always begin the next turn.
10. MOST IMPORTANTLY: All aspects of our text adventure game should allude to the central theme of brutality, strife, the evil nature of man and the gruesome demands of survival inside the Berserk universe where our game takes place.

Begin!

Guts and Puck are traveling through a dense forest, the canopy overhead is so thick that it blocks out most of the sunlight. Suddenly, they come across a group of possessed forest spirits. The spirits are wielding sharp branches and twigs as weapons and are fiercely defending their territory.

A) Tell Guts to use his Dragon Slayer to cut through the spirits.
B) Suggest that Guts use his agility to dodge the spirits and find a weakness.
C) Urge Guts to use his surrounding environment to his advantage.

What is your choice, player?

You tell Guts to use his surroundings to his advantage. Guts surveys the area, noticing the streams of light that break through the dense canopy and illuminates the spirits. He uses this to his advantage, using the light to blind the spirits and making it easier for him to strike them down.

With quick movements, Guts is able to take down the spirits one by one, using the environment to his advantage. After a grueling battle, Guts emerges victorious.

As a reward, Puck finds a small vial of holy water in the possession of one of the spirits. This could be useful in future encounters with other supernatural beings.

Next turn:

Guts and Puck are making their way through a dark and damp dungeon, the walls covered in moss and the ground slick with slime. Suddenly, a massive troll emerges from the shadows, wielding a massive club. The troll bellows a deafening roar and charges towards Guts.

A) Suggest that Guts use his Dragon Slayer to cut through the troll.
B) Urge Guts to use his agility to dodge the troll's slow movements.
C) Tell Guts to use the holy water as a weapon against the troll.

What is your choice, player?

You suggest that Guts use his Dragon Slayer to cut through the troll. Guts grips the massive sword with both hands and charges towards the troll. The troll swings its club, but Guts is able to dodge the attack and strike the troll with the Dragon Slayer.

Despite the troll's massive size and strength, the Dragon Slayer proves to be too much for it and the troll falls to the ground, defeated.

As a reward, Puck finds a small pouch of Troll Fat in the troll's possession. This fat is known to have powerful healing properties and could prove to be useful in the future.

Next turn:

Guts and Puck are making their way through a dark and eerie swamp, the ground soft and spongy beneath their feet. Suddenly, they come across a horde of demons, their eyes glowing red in the darkness. The demons are fiercely protecting a powerful artifact, a cursed mirror.

A) Urge Guts to use his agility to dodge the demons and reach the mirror.
B) Suggest that Guts use the holy water as a weapon against the demons.
C) Tell Guts to use the Troll Fat to lure the demons away from the mirror.

What is your choice, player?

You suggest that Guts use the holy water as a weapon against the demons. Guts pulls out the vial of holy water and throws it at the demons. The holy water makes contact and the demons scream in agony as it burns their flesh.

With the demons momentarily stunned, Guts takes the opportunity to strike them down one by one. After a fierce battle, Guts emerges victorious and the demons are defeated.

As a reward, Puck finds the cursed mirror in the possession of the demons. This mirror is said to have the power to grant wishes, but at a terrible cost.

Next turn:

Guts and Puck are making their way through a ruined city, the buildings shattered and the streets littered with debris. Suddenly, they come across a powerful sorceress, her eyes glowing with magic. She is fiercely guarding a powerful spellbook, said to contain spells of immense power.

A) Suggest that Guts use the Dragon Slayer to cut through the sorceress.
B) Urge Guts to use the cursed mirror to grant a wish for victory.
C) Tell Guts to use his agility to dodge the sorceress's spells and reach the spellbook.

What is your choice, player?
